Yes, a lot of people think the pleasure craft licence or registration is proof of ownership, it's not, the bill of sale is.Â  therefore you keep both in the boat with you. This is copied directly from Transport Canada. A licence does not prove that you own your pleasure craft. You must carry separate ownership documents with you.

Hulls need to be registered if motors 10hp or greater. You transfer your hull registration online with Transport Canada, not MTO. You need to submit a copy of your bill of sale. You will also need to supply the sellers name and info.
